Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery krater; interior: top of neck painted; exterior, white slip: on neck, animal frieze in silhouette style, depicting goat grazing to left (hind legs, one foreleg, and rump remaining) with added red; dot rosette, pinwheel rosette, and lozenge as filling ornament; below, maeander frieze; on shoulder, black-figure frieze: large palmette to left; facing it, fully preserved, neck and head of griffin; thick filling ornament; black band below, with added red band, and traces of third frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Sherd is very similar to Oxford G120.1 . Either both sherds belong to the same vessel or they were by the same painter, probably the former. Also illustrated by Chr. Kardara, Rodiaki Aggeiographia (1963) pl. 13c.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.564)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 942a, pl. 115)
